question: You have created a new subdomain for your popular website, and you need this subdomain to point to an Elastic Load Balancer using Route53. Which DNS record set type (or DNS extension type) could you create? (Choose 2).
True or False: There is a limit to the number of domain names that you can manage using Route 53.
choice1: False. By default, you can support as many domain names on Route 53 as you want.
choice2: True and False. With Route 53, there is a default limit of 20 domain names. However, this limit can be increased by contacting AWS support.
choice3: True. There is a hard limit of 10 domain names. You cannot go above this number.

question: Which of the following Route 53 policies allow you to route data to a second resource if the first is unhealthy, and route data to resources that have better performance?

You have an enterprise solution that operates Active-Active with facilities in Regions US-West and India. Due to growth in the Asian market you have been directed by the CTO to ensure that only traffic in Asia (between Turkey and Japan) is directed to the India Region. Which of these will deliver that result?
choice1: CloudFront - a combination of blacklisting and whitelisting to control which countries go to which site
choice2: Route 53 - Weighted routing policy, calculate the proportion of customers in each and weight the policy to ensure that each location gets a fair load.
choice4: Latency routing policy. This will ensure only customers that are close will go to the India installation.

question: You are hosting websites in the eu-west-2 and ap-southeast-2 regions, and would like visitors from United Kingdom to see a different site than those in Australia. Which Routing Policy would help you to accomplish this?
Route 53 is named so because ____.
choice1: Beats me: only people in marketing can tell you the reason behind its name.
choice3: The DNS Port is on Port 53 and Route 53 is a DNS Service.
choice4: Route 66 was already registered with Microsoft.

question: In AWS Route 53, which of the following are true?
choice1: A CNAME record assigns an Alias name to an IP address.
choice2: Alias Records provide a Route 53â€“specific extension to DNS functionality
choice3: Alias Records can point at any resources in AWS, but only within the same account
choice4: Route 53 allows you to create an Alias record at the top node of a DNS namespace (zone apex)
choice5: Alias Records can point at any resource with a Canonical Name.
choice6: Route 53 allows you to create a CNAME record at the top node of a DNS namespace (zone apex)

question: Your company hosts 8 web servers all serving the same web content in AWS. They want Route 53 to serve traffic to random web servers. Which routing policy will meet this requirement, and provide the best resiliency?
You have purchased 'mycoolcompany.com' on the AWS registrar and would like for it to point to lb1-1234.us-east-2.elb.amazonaws.com . What sort of Route 53 record is NOT POSSIBLE to set up for this?

You have deployed a new Elastic Beanstalk environment and would like to direct 5% of your production traffic to this new environment, in order to monitor for CloudWatch metrics and ensuring no bugs exist. What type of Route 53 records allows you to do so?

After updating a Route 53 record to point 'myapp.mydomain.com' from an old Load Balancer to a new load balancer, it looks like the users are still not redirected to your new load balancer. You are wondering why...
choice1: Its because of the alias record
choice2: Its because of the CNAME record
choice4: Its because of the health checks

question: You want your users to get the best possible user experience and that means minimizing the response time from your servers to your users. Which routing policy will help?
You have a legal requirement that people in any country but France should not be able to access your website. Which Route 53 record helps you in achieving this?
You have purchased a domain on Godaddy and would like to use it with Route 53. What do you need to change to make this work?
choice2: Create a private hosted zone and update the 3rd party registrar NS records
choice3: Create a public hosted zone and update Route 53 NS records
choice4: Create a public hosted zone and update the 3rd party registrar NS records
